Google Developer Days (GDD) are global events showcasing the latest developer products and platforms from Google to help you quickly develop high quality apps, grow & retain an active user base, and tap into tools to earn more.

GDG Gulu will run a one-day Extended event to learn the content delivered on the big GDD event.

events.name: Cloud Study Jam- Gulu
events.description:
Learn the fundamentals of the Google Cloud Platform, how to run containers on it and how to use the platform for data engineering. Attendees get free access to the labs ($70+ value). No need to create a Google Cloud Platform account or register with a credit card.

How long does it take?
One in-person session of 3 hours, followed by 2-8 hours of self-study.

What is the end result?
Attendees will:
1) Learn how to set up development and production environments in the Cloud.
2) Learn how Docker and Kubernetes work, or learn how to process Big Data in the Cloud.
3) Get access to Qwiklabs.com, a Google training tool, free of charge (a $70+ value).
4) Get Google-hosted badges for your online profiles, to show potential employers what you know about Cloud Computing.

• What to bring
Laptop, pen and a notebook.

• Important to know
This event is FREE to attend.

events.name: TensorFlow DevSummit Extended Gulu
events.description:
What we'll do
You probably have heard about Machine Learning (ML) and all the amazing things it can do. Well, here is your chance to learn about ML during the Machine Learning Study Jam where we will run through the Machine Learning Crash Course (MLCC).

This course is intended for those who wish to learn about ML from a practical applied perspective that will enable you to use machine learning in your everyday projects and learn about the power of TensorFlow. This a great opportunity for anyone with basic technical knowledge and limited Machine Learning knowledge willing to gain some practical experience in ML and TensorFlow.

events.name: Build Action For Your Community-Gulu
events.description:
• What we'll do
“Build Actions for Your Community” is an open and modular event series designed by Google and offered to community organizers worldwide. This year, GDG Gulu will run two events in series to equip developers with the necessary skills to develop for Google Assistant.

• What to bring
Laptop, Power Cord,

• Important to know

events.name: I/O Extended 2018 Gulu
events.description: Google I/O features hands-on learning, Google's latest developer products, and technical talks given by the engineers who are developing Google's latest APIs and tools–plus a few surprises along the way and I/O Extended 2018 Gulu will be bringing you closer to the best collection of materials and codelabs!

events.name: Android and Web Training Camp
events.description:
Let us take you into a deeper experience, make a moment a lasting conveyable memory. Let us help build your tribe.
Come and learn the latest technologies on android and web development

Carry along your laptop, phones and power cords.

events.name: Next '18 Extended Gulu
events.description: Join us for this year's Next Extended event! We are excited to be bringing our developer community to be part of Next '18 event by bringing the event near to you. During this year's extended event, we bring you the latest technologies in Machine Learning with Google Cloud technologies. RSVP and come and be a part of this exciting experience as we dive into the future of cloud computing with Google.

events.name: Flutter Study Jam
events.description: Come and Learn Flutter for hybrid mobile apps development. Develop your Android and iOS app from one codebase. Fun. Isn't it? Sign Up for our Flutter Study Jam and develop the right skills you based on Udacity's Flutter Course.

events.name: Flutter Study Jam
events.description:
Come and Learn Flutter for hybrid mobile apps development. Develop your Android and iOS app from one codebase. Fun. Isn't it? Sign Up for our Flutter Study Jam and develop the right skills you based on Udacity's Flutter Course.

Bring a laptop! The course will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers.

Requirements
The laptop should have Flutter installed on it prior to starting the study jam to save time. Windows/Linux/Mac would all be fine. Check out: https://flutter.io/get-started/install/
Remember the event is free

events.name: Flutter Study Jam
events.description: Come and Learn Flutter for hybrid mobile apps development. Develop your Android and iOS app from one codebase. Fun. Isn't it? Sign Up for our Flutter Study Jam and develop the right skills you based on Udacity's Flutter Course.

events.name: DevFest 2018
events.description:
GDG DevFest 2018 is our annual all-day developer conference that offers speaker sessions across multiple product areas, codelabs, hackathon and more!
Join GDG Gulu for this year's DevFest 2018 annual all-day developer conference.
Join us for the Developer's Festival on the 28th October from 9:00 am to 6:00 pm daily and experience speaker sessions, codelabs and a hackathon, while networking for great opportunities.
We shall cover topics that shape technology today including AI and Cloud, Web and Android technologies.

Who should attend?

1) Software Developers and Engineers
2) DevOps Engineers
3) Tech Enthusiasts

Requirements:
i) Those who would like to get their hands dirty with code are advised to carry a laptop.
Please fill the form linked https://goo.gl/forms/HzsGnTgKhJatsDff1 to give your details and expectations (Highly recommended).

events.name: Flutter Viewing Party
events.description:
Join us on Tuesday 4th December at Gulu University from 9:00 to 5:30 pm for the viewing party and a Flutter talk as we join the rest of the world in Flutter Viewing Party. We’re hosting Flutter Live where we’ll share a variety of news and updates about Flutter.

Just a sec! CODELABs? Yes codelabs in follow up sessions! Come ready to get your hands dirty!

Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

Flutter's hot reload helps you quickly and easily experiment, build UIs, add features, and fix bugs faster. Experience sub-second reload times, without losing state, on emulators, simulators, and hardware for iOS and Android.

Watch the introduction Video: https://goo.gl/pHxTUf

See you there!

events.name: Cloud Study Jam[Machine  Learning]
events.description:
• What we'll do
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin or you have experience with the platform

Join us for our Cloud Study Jam with our good friends in DevOps! Together we'll work through Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs and Kubernetes labs. Don't worry if you haven't had any experience with GCP or Kubernetes. We need start from the beginning.

If you can't finish during the meetup you will have plenty of time to finish at home and if you finish one quest of labs you will receive a Google Hosted badge for your online profile. You will also be able to finish any of the other labs on your own. .

• What to bring
Bring a laptop (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed.

events.name: TensorFlow Dev Summit Extended Gulu 2019
events.description:
TensorFlow Dev Summit brings together a diverse mix of machine learning users from around the world for two days of highly technical talks, demos, and conversation with the TensorFlow team and community.
This year, GDG Gulu will bring to you TensorFlow Dev Summit Extended featuring Hands on code labs and tech talks
It is free to attend the event just reserve a slot and you are in.
You need to come along with your laptop

events.name: Next '19 Extended Gulu
events.description:
Join us for this year's Next Extended event, where we'll bring together cloud enthusiasts and the developer community to be a part of the Next '19 experience.

This year, we will be diving deep into cloud with technical keynotes, a hands-on TOPIC (Kubernetes, ML, or Google Cloud Certification) lab, and local speakers.

As an attendee, you'll not only be a part of our vibrant cloud community but also receive free access to Qwiklabs (a $55+ value)!

Don't forget to bring a laptop (PC, Mac, or Chromebook), and get ready for the best Next Extended yet!

Make sure to RSVP to receive upcoming information about this event, and visit https://cloudnext.withgoogle.com/ to learn more about Google Cloud Next '19.

events.name: I/O Extended Gulu
events.description:
Welcome to I/O Extended 2019! Join us for some livestream content of the Google I/O conference as well as some live talks and hands-on labs!

SAMPLE Agenda:
8:00am: Check-in and breakfast
9:00am: Google I/O keynote starts
9:00am - 12:00pm: Google I/O keynote and sessions, concurrent with live dev talks
12:00pm: Lunch
12:00pm-4:30pm: Codelabs

events.name: TensorFlow 2.0 & Documentation Sprint
events.description:
TensorFlow 2.0 is a major release focused on ease of use and clarity while maintains its flexibility. Are you interested in learning about what is new with TensorFlow 2.0?

Would you like to contribute to TensorFlow 2.0 and learn the PR and review process? You can get started by improving its documentation.

Come join the pilot of the global docs sprint at GDG Seattle, where Paige Bailey and Margaret Maynard-Reid will walk through how to review and create pull requests for making changes to TensorFlow documentation. There will be other TensorFlow contributors joining remotely as well.

Target audience: ideally you know Machine Learning, TensorFlow or Python but it's not a pre-requisite in order to contribute to TensorFlow docs.

SCHEDULE
9:30AM Check-in & breakfast
10:00AM Intro to TensorFlow 2.0, Paige Bailey
10:30 AM Contribute to TensorFlow Docs, Paige Bailey & Margaret Maynard-Reid
10:45AM Hands-on. [Please bring your own computer]
12:00PM Lunch
12:45PM Wrap up and next steps

Paige Bailey (twitter handle: @DynamicWebPaige)
~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Paige is a TensorFlow Developer Advocate at Google, based in Mountain View, CA. Prior to joining Google, Paige worked as a senior software engineer in the office of the Azure CTO; as a Cloud Developer Advocate for machine learning at Microsoft; and as a data scientist for Chevron in Houston, TX. Paige has over a decade of experience using Python for data analysis, five years of experience doing machine learning - and can't wait to show you about the new capabilities in TensorFlow 2.0.

Margaret Maynard-Reid (twitter handle: @margaretmz)
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Margaret is a Google Developer Expert (GDE) for Machine Learning, and she develops Android apps with intelligence. She leads GDG Seattle and co-organizes Seattle Data/Analytics/Machine Learning meetup groups. She writes blogs and speaks at conferences on TensorFlow, deep learning and Android. She is passionate about community building and helping others get into Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning.

PARKING & TRANSPORTATIONS
This will be held in building B (room KIR-6THB-1-Backstreet/Banana Seat) at Google Kirkland. When you arrive you can park in a guest parking spot by building A or B.

events.name: Kotlin Everywhere
events.description: Join us for a Kotlin Everywhere event where we shall feature the best talks and codelabs on Kotlin for Android, Google Cloud Platform, and what's more? Multi-platform. Meet the Uganda, Kotlin User Group gurus. Grab the best of the day with Kotlin!

events.name: Flutter Study Jam
events.description:
Flutter is Google’s portable UI kit for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.
Want to get started on building Flutter apps?
Join us for our Flutter Study Jam! Together we'll work through Flutter codelabs prepared by Google instructors. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Flutter and build a Flutter app while learning the fundamentals.
Bring a laptop! The course will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, the laptop should have Flutter installed on it prior to starting the study jam to save time. Windows/Linux/Mac would all be fine. Check out: https://flutter.dev/docs/get-started/install

upcoming.name: VR day
upcoming.description:
Virtual Reality Day is a series of global events organized with the goal of making VR and AR become more accessible to the public. Individuals and organizations can participate by hosting free and public events to showcase VR.
In addition to the games and experiences, live sessions, workshops and chats, this year’s event will also feature the latest software and hardware releases in VR including Beat Saber on Oculus Quest. Participants will have a chance to participate in FIFA (PlayStation), League of Legends (PC) and Beat Saber (VR) tournaments. Prizes will be awarded to the top three participants in each of the tournaments.
This year’s event will also be inclusive of the blind and visually impaired. Little Timothy, a PC Adventure game which is inclusive of the blind will be available for all attendees to play at the event. Little Timothy was created by the Game Development team at O&P-UG.

upcoming.name: Flutter Interact: Viewing Party
upcoming.description: Join us for a live viewing and learning party on Flutter and DartLang and be a part of #FlutterInteract 2019 and your build your career along the future of Software Development with Flutter.

group_profile.intro: Google Developer Group Gulu is a group of passionate Independent Google developers based in Gulu City, Northern Uganda.
